website_summaries.verdict: This is the ultimate survivalist's knife – strong, versatile and built to stand up to the toughest conditions.
pros: Comes with a nylon sheath and a lanyard that has an emergency whistle
Sheath includes blade sharpener and fire starter
cons: Users have said that the coating quickly wears off the knife

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 14 yr old boy scout as a gift before our week-long 72mi backpacking trip with his troop. Both Gerber and BG I thought were strong names, plus there was some sentiment for a BG knife he owned in the past. Unfortunately, it did not last the week. The piece on the sheath that says "Gerber" broke off and the fire-starter fell out and got lost somewhere on the trail as we were hiking. Very disappointed. I was going to have this engraved with some details of our hike. Glad now that I couldn't find the time to do it before the hike. I hope I can return.
customer_reviews.author: dethan

customer_reviews.title: A successful failure
customer_reviews.text: After owning for a couple of years, I had to downgrade it from 3 stars to 1 star 1 the ferror rod is way too short and awkward to use 2 the serrated blade is too short to saw anything big and rendered sharpening impossible 3 the blade material is inferior, chip easily(sharpen easily too though) It seems to have everything you need in a very neat package, but this is one of those: can do everything but none excel tool
customer_reviews.author: Lqw

customer_reviews.title: Dont forget to compare to the pro model of this knife
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't aware that they made a "Pro" model of this knife. A more expensive, slightly better version. So I returned this knife and bought the pro model. Here is my very limited review of this knife. Cons- Made in China. Doesn't have a full tang all the way through the handle. Fire starter installs upside down in the sheath, so it can fall out and you will never notice. Stupid marketing. Pros - blade was sharp, feels great in the hand, seems very tough and durable. Knife feels substantial in the hand, like it will be there when you need it. In conclusion, I have no doubt that this knife will serve you well and have a long life.
customer_reviews.author: Heisenberg

customer_reviews.title: Really good knife for first time camping knife.
customer_reviews.text: I am a first time camper buying a knife that would last a long time and is very good for multi use. I have great reviews about this knife and having it in my hands I definitely think it’s worth the money whether you’re new to camping/survival or not. I also really adore that this knife comes with a sharpening kit in the case, however, nowhere in the paper survival guide or on any packaging does it explain how to use this feature. I bought a separate knife sharpener because it was very frustrating and I couldn’t find much info anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Kat Thurau

customer_reviews.title: Ultimate Survival Knife.
customer_reviews.text: My son always borrowed the one I had purchased last year & loved it so much that I bought his own so he won't use mine any longer. Fast Ship, Professional packaging. Extremely well made, works better than expected. A great survival Knife indeed!! Job well orchestrated from the point of sale all the way to receipt of the product. Will recommend highly. Anthony.H Burlington. MA
customer_reviews.author: ANTHONY HAMBOYAN

customer_reviews.title: Gerber Grylls ultimate knife
customer_reviews.text: The knife is solid but loses one star for the sheath quality. It comes sharp and really feels good in the hands. The fire starter works well with the machined area on the back of the knife, It throws plenty of hot sparks. The knife sharpener seems to work well even the whistle while not super loud will still alert someone in a quiet environment. I like the survivor manual but the pocket on the back of the sheath split when I tried to slide the manual in. This is the third Grylls knife I have purchased two smooth blade for myself and daughter and one serrated which I purchased on sale.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Sheath broke before first use
customer_reviews.text: Thought this looked like a good product until the sheath cracked(light grey plastic holding case) making the knife slip in and out of it's cradle. Haven't even had the opportunity to use the knife yet. Was purchased for a camping trip. Unfortunately, it is now useless and a bit of a safety hazard to carry. There is no option to contact the seller directly to request a return/refund. (at least none that I can see).
customer_reviews.author: Seegs 13

customer_reviews.title: Dose not come in English
customer_reviews.text: Knife works good. But the survival guide and paperwork came in a foreign language. When I contacted their cs I was informed that the supplier didn't have any other languages available. So if you can speak Czech than its a good deal. If not, your just getting the hardware.
customer_reviews.author: Breeze

customer_reviews.title: A good knife to bang on the back of the tang ...
customer_reviews.text: A good knife to bang on the back of the tang of the blade with a rock to make a shelter of branches/fallen trees/etc. The alloy used for this knife is just garbage so don't expect to keep this sharp or to be used for heavy duty. So, you can use this to make a shelter in an emergency situation one time. After that you're out of luck if the built-in sharper won't sharpen the blade enough again in said emergency situation. Have a different knife for self-defense/protection.
customer_reviews.author: R.

customer_reviews.title: China made but great knife
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this as a gift for my sister to take on her hikes. I had it shipped to her and had a chance to look at it today. I am impressed by everything you get for the money, the blade is sharp and appears to be decent quality considering its made in China. My brother has had the same knife for years, he beat the knife nearly to death doing irrigation and it keeps on going. This is a well made knife and you get a lot for the money.
customer_reviews.author: frank

customer_reviews.title: Great but the updated/pro version is recommended.
customer_reviews.text: After ordering this and receiving it, I decided to look up more Gerber knives and found out that a pro/updated version of this knife was also released. This knife is pretty handy on it's own but if you are willing to spend a few extra bucks for a better design and better knife, get the pro version. Really sharp out the package. Whistle is a nice touch but with the abuse this knife is made to take, this whistle might break easy as it is made of plastic. Grip is great, "firestarter" works for what it's made to do, love the sheath.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Martinez

customer_reviews.title: It's a knife not a lawn mower ok Karen and Karl!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this knife it held up to everything I've thrown at it. It also has that intimidation factor. So if you pull it out on the neighborhood junkie cause he thinks it's ok to break into your car he will piss him self. I don't care to much for the college rape whistle because I really don't know if I would ever use it.
customer_reviews.author: The Alpha Male

customer_reviews.title: Great knife... is replacement of the ferrocerium rod available?
customer_reviews.text: Nice knife. The ferrocerium rod worked very well altho, unfortunately, it fell out immediately. Would very much like to get a replacement rod. Gerber, is this available?
customer_reviews.author: Pamela L Rangel

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, sharp
customer_reviews.text: I don't spend my nights camping in a hotel like Bear Grylls. Great knife anyway.
customer_reviews.author: NWHiker_Tom

customer_reviews.title: Perfect survival knife for a young survivalist
customer_reviews.text: Bought this knife for my son. Very well made, comfortable handle, light but strong, and fantastic built in designs. The fire starter works better than any other that I have an I have no fear of it falling out. Snaps in tight. The sharpener on the inside of the sheath is well placed and easily usable. There is even a small notch out on the spine that exposes just enough blade for use with the ferrous rod. Not for large scale work, but great for beginners and young looking to learn the craft.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn F.

customer_reviews.title: Pros Performance- Great knife that is still sharp today
customer_reviews.text: Got this knife to test my survival skills. Ibought this product about 3 years ago. Here are my observations and thoughts on this knife and brand: Pros Performance- Great knife that is still sharp today. Easy to resharpen, comes with survival tips that neatly fold into knife holster. Durability- I left it outside in the yard for 4 days, I live in beach town, and it did not rust. I've had it 3 years used it for everything from cutting cans to pork shoulders, tomatoes and still great. Cons None Note- It is nice and heavy, you can tell it is a good quality knife. I practice throwing it at a tree and it hasn't bent yet.
customer_reviews.author: Eliseo Alvarez

customer_reviews.title: Great kit for beginners
customer_reviews.text: The good: Took it to camping a few times and it works great. Flint sparks significantly, but before you use it you need to get with of the black coating. the knife is sharp enough to make feather sticks easily. For a beginner use, this setup is great for the price. The not so good: Not a big fan of the serrated edge, makes sharpening extremely difficult, and the survival manual is instructive but unfortunately there is no pouch for the guide so it would get lose rather easily.
customer_reviews.author: Akai

customer_reviews.title: he always takes it hiking or camping and he said he has made good use of it
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves this knife and never leaves home without it! Ok, that is a lie, but this is the truth, he always takes it hiking or camping and he said he has made good use of it. He was so excited the day he came home and said he was able to use the spark thing to start a camp fire. It seems like a sturdy and well made and seems to hold it's edge well. I bought the Bear Grylls branded knife because my husband's favorite color is orange and no other reason, but there are neat little extra's in this line too, so that is nice.
customer_reviews.author: DazeyChain

customer_reviews.title: It’s sharp!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this knife. It’s my first real knife for heavy duty camping, and I found out to handle it with care. Good buy and high quality.
customer_reviews.author: KateQ

customer_reviews.title: expensive for what u get
customer_reviews.text: their is better value knives out there for 50bucks. Bear grylls ultimate survival is ok survival knife but not as good as Les Stroud sk mountain survival knife. Les stroud knife comes with more assessories and is all around better for 30bucks
customer_reviews.author: billy helton

customer_reviews.title: Solid
customer_reviews.text: Solid solid solid. This thing will be able to take a beating once I get it out in the woods. I've already hacked some things around the yard to try it out. More solid than I was expecting before it arrived. The sharpener works better than the one I bought for my house to sharpen my kitchen knives. Didn't try out the other features yet. Oh and sharp. Came sharp already and doesn't need any adjustment. Looks bad ass when in the pouch and hanging from your hip. Enjoy this and have fun. I'll try to repost after the summer when I get a chance to go outside and really give it a try
customer_reviews.author: swanny

customer_reviews.title: I really like this knife
customer_reviews.text: I really like this knife. I know a lot of knife geeks talk smack about them, but I have found it to be a good quality knife. I skinned a rabbit with it and it was almost too sharp. I had to be very careful. I keep it in my truck as part of a get home bag, so it's not getting a lot of constant use or abuse.
customer_reviews.author: FredlyFX

customer_reviews.title: Great quality knife
customer_reviews.text: I use this knife all the time when I go camping, fishing, hunting, or just want to start a fire in the back yard. It has stayed sharp for a long time. I did have to sharpen it after cleaning animals after a hunting trip, but I cleaned about 6 animals. The quality of the knife is spectacular, I mean it is Gerber afterall. The serrated part came in handy, particularly during hunting. I haven't tried wrapping it around a stick and using it as a spear yet, but I will be trying that soon.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Price

customer_reviews.title: great knife at a great price.
customer_reviews.text: great basic knife. comes with a feral rod and the knife has a spot on back to strike it well. it keeps a good edge while working with it, and you can even toss it into a tree and not worry about it falling apart. nice and strong, even with the 3/4 tang. the butt piece hammers o.k. in a pinch. I love the scabbard, on the inside/ flip side inside is a touch up stone to keep it sharp. great knife for only 33 bucks or so. I will buy more to give to pals.
customer_reviews.author: steve

customer_reviews.title: Gerber Survival Knife 31-000751
customer_reviews.text: This product was extremely well thought out in my opinion. The balance, fit, and functions it's possesses will stagger my imagination. The handle comes equipped with a waffle style hammer head and the blade can balance perfectly on it. The holes drilled in the hilt are designed to be tied to a stick for hunting if in a true survival scenario. The stone on the back of the sheath appears to be thin diamond impregnated metal. The small paper book/pamphlet that come with is a bit cheesy but that is the only short cut taken here! I'm impressed with this one!
customer_reviews.author: Scott Giberson

customer_reviews.title: Good overall package
customer_reviews.text: I had only moderate expectations (thought that the Bear Gryls thing might be gimmicky) but I think this is a great knife. It's well designed and has a solidly build. The hard sheath is way better than the nylon sheaths that come with most knives. I haven't used the attacked sharpener but it's nice to have it always handy. The flint is and whistle are nice bonuses. I'm happy with my purchase - this knife is the real deal.
customer_reviews.author: JDRanger

customer_reviews.title: Awesome.
customer_reviews.text: Great knife, I use it for everything. The grip is nice and rubbery, the fire starter works fine. I feel like Bear, because I use it to survive in my office in front of my Computer, where I'm not actually in any danger. Actually, I think if I drink the brownish water in the bottle under my desk, I'd be in more danger than Bear.
customer_reviews.author: JamieBaker

customer_reviews.title: For my "Go TO" emergency pack.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my emergency prepareness "go to" bag, and when I had to go cross county it sure came in handy a couple of times. It is a really well constructed knife and well made. They thought of everything you would need in a knife. I love the whistle too. I keep that on my keychain now because it is small. On top of that it not too expensive for a good knife.
customer_reviews.author: Rogue Artist

customer_reviews.title: Great knife!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this knife! Have had this knife for a few years now. Great for camping. Stays sharp, easy to carry...what's not to love?! Would recommend this product to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Drewry

customer_reviews.title: Good Knife
customer_reviews.text: Received the knife on time and in good shape. The knife is good quality, the fire starter and whislte are great additions to the knife. The scabbard opens and the knife sharpener is on the inside and protected, I really appreciate that feature. The knife is sharp out of the box, the fire starter sparks and the whislte blows (my dogs did not appreciate the whistle) I haven't had a chance to use the fire starter but having used similar ones is the past, I expect it to fair well. Overall, I am very pleased with the knife and happy I made the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: jpstr00

customer_reviews.title: Field knife
customer_reviews.text: I scout and hunt alone, and remain in field minimum weeks at a time; hunt season month or more. I sharp edge up and use this knife for bathroom holes. The sharp edge for clearing grass/weeds other, and when I wake with foot of snow, I use it to tear into down trees to get dry wood inside to start fires. I velcro it to my right calf under knee pad above lowa boot. Excellent knife!
customer_reviews.author: Curt

customer_reviews.title: Decent knife, decent utility.
customer_reviews.text: The whistle is quite faint and is kind of like a novelty item; however, the magnesium strip works well and is great as a fire-starter. The knife itself arrived kind of dull, but with a little love, it isn't bad. The orange makes it easy to find if you drop it in the woods and it has a good weight to it.
customer_reviews.author: IATFalcon

customer_reviews.title: Super Knife
customer_reviews.text: I thought I hated serrations but in the last 18 months I have been using the original Ultimate Survival knife, which I got through Amazon, in Canada, Eastern and southern USA, and where I now work, South East Asia, where I instruct forest rangers in field craft and Survival. The serrations really are usefull in the jungle, and are an asset not a hindrance. I also got a "Fine" edge but...it sits at home! This knife has performed well, from cold and snowy to the steaming hot jungles here. And the orange colour makes it look "toy like" which is great in places were the cops get upset about knives - much more "friendly" looking!!!
customer_reviews.author: Warden

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Knife
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best survival knives I have ever come across. The feel, quality, durability in my opinion is unmatched. Not to mention all the different ways I can apply this knife in a survival situation. VERY useful tool. Highly recommend! Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy knife
customer_reviews.text: Good solid knife. Fits tightly in the sheath the fire starter is a nice touch too works very well. The pommel on the end is sturdy too I’ve beat the hell out of it and it’s held up. I haven’t had any issues with it I really like this knife.
customer_reviews.author: Becky Ford

customer_reviews.title: Stays Sharp, Starts Fires
customer_reviews.text: The edge comes relatively sharp, and sharpens fairly easily with the supplied sharpener. The fire starter works wonderfully, throwing a plethora of sparks with every stroke. Used it to start our fires while camping this weekend, and it lit my PET balls after 3-4 strokes of the mag rod every time. I haven't used it for anything very serious (like chopping or batoning), but it feels sturdy enough to take whatever I can dish out. This whistle is so-so, you'd probably want a better one if in a survival situation. Overall, a very good camp knife that would work well in a survival situation.
customer_reviews.author: Neil Sutherland

customer_reviews.title: Excellent survival knife by an excellent brand!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this knife when it was on sale and much cheaper on Amazon than anything I've seen in stores like Walmart or Dicks Sporting Goods. The knife is high quality and sharp right out of the package! It comes with a Velcro sheath, a sharpener, a whistle, a flint stick, a hardened grip hammer end, and a survival guide with no where to put it on the knife set. Two holes on each side of the blade look to be for securing the knife to a stick for use as a spear. Nice quality survival knife and a must for camping trips or a Zombie apocalypse.
customer_reviews.author: Gear Know-How

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievable deal
customer_reviews.text: My boy scout son wanted one of these for the numerous campouts in which he participates each year. The first site he gave me had it listed at over $70, which made me hold off. On Black Friday, I was at Wal-Mart and found it for "only" $46, so I grabbed it. A week later, I happened to check here on Amazon and found it for $26 - the same exact knife being sold for $46 and $70+ elsewhere. Purchased it here, returned the other to Wally World, and my son was extremely happy on Christmas morning.
customer_reviews.author: Mom of 4

customer_reviews.title: Lifetime warranty for under $40
customer_reviews.text: My nephew loved this as a gift. I think I made his dad mad because he liked this better than the gift he gave him which was a compound bow. He has not had any problems with it and it has been holding up to him cutting everything. This also comes with a lifetime warranty. So if he breaks it he can get a new one from the manufacture.
customer_reviews.author: BC Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great Knife
customer_reviews.text: This knife looks ridiculous, and honestly as someone who goes backpacking a lot, it is a bit over the top. However, this knife is actually the best knife I own as far as strength and versatility. I took the lanyard / whistle off because I don't need one, but the striker works well for starting fires. Overall I actually love this knife and always bring it if I am on my own for the mental illusion of protection. Great value, great product.
customer_reviews.author: Chadwick Holloman

customer_reviews.title: Great knife despite what the "cool kids says" lol usually ...
customer_reviews.text: Great knife despite what the "cool kids says" lol usually wanna be's. no it's Not full tang and has serattions on it, but that's what makes it great. It's a very good all purpose knife and everybody should get one... I have lots of knives including another great- LMF Gerber 2-- made for halo pilots but works for anybody! Last Must have--- Schrade survival knife is the third everybody should have. This last one is full tang.
customer_reviews.author: gregg

customer_reviews.title: Overall a good knife
customer_reviews.text: The knife itself and the case are fully functional and well made. But, the little orange fabric/plastic label on the back was torn before we opened the package. It’s dissappointing because I can’t fix it, and the information seems valuable.
customer_reviews.author: Marisa LS

customer_reviews.title: Excellent camping knife, basic survival knife
customer_reviews.text: Bought this fix blade knife and fire starter to add to my camping/backpacking/survival kit. It's a little heavy for light weight backpacking, but I strap it to my belt and it's fine. Sturdy blade and nonslip grip is excellent for wet and cold conditions. Orange accents make it a little easier to find if you drop it. Striker makes nice sparks.
customer_reviews.author: SkiBreck

customer_reviews.title: solid knife
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid knife and the sheath it's in is not only strong but secure. the knife clicks into place plus velcro. the fire stick clicks in securely. I'm very impressed with this knife. It's definitely a good value.
customer_reviews.author: Esther

customer_reviews.title: Tough enough
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my 13 year old son. While he does not treat it with disrespect (chopping rocks) he is certainly not easy on it. The pommel and hammering is not an issue with this one. Apparently that has been fixed. My son knew about this issue and took it as a challenge. If Bear Grylls, and others, has demonstrated a technique my son has tried it with this knife. No serious blade nicks. No bends. Price/Performance wise it excels which is what Gerber does.
customer_reviews.author: GEH

customer_reviews.title: Great Knife
customer_reviews.text: I now have three of these and expect to order another soon to complete my bug out bag project. I have many, many fixed blade knives and this is my choice for survival needs. The whistle works well and I love the integrated fire steel in the sheath. The built in sharpener looks handy though I have not as yet had occasion to use it. There is also some useful info on the enclosed booklet which fits into a pocket on the back of the sheath.
customer_reviews.author: Holly Justice

customer_reviews.title: Great stainless steel, fixed blade survival knife with serrated edge and sheath.
customer_reviews.text: This knife had so many extras that I was amazed to hunt and find. I hope I never need to save my life with this survival tool, but if that time comes, this is the "lifesaver" I will be glad to have! There is a firestarter, a whistle, a knife sharpener, a guide to survival. The handle base is strong enough to be used as a hammer and there are two holes so that the knife can be lashed to a sturdy stick to make a spear.
customer_reviews.author: K. Shattles

customer_reviews.title: Good camping knife
customer_reviews.text: Broke the striker the first week owning it. Other than that, it’s a great knife. Folds up in weird ways to hold the knife. Great loops for your belt, and a nice hammer like for the handle.
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: The firestarter is too easy to lose!
customer_reviews.text: I have no problem with the knife, but the sheath design wasn't well thought out for the firestarter. It inserts into the sheath near the bottom. I had the sheath strapped to my belt, and lost the firestarter while hiking in a forest, most likely when I brushed against some branches, snagging the firestarter.
customer_reviews.author: PatA

customer_reviews.title: A good value buy
customer_reviews.text: Haven't had a chance to use it much, but overall the construction is good. Used to cut down some small dried Fir limbs, and did try the built-in firestarter; after some practice and getting used to, it did provide some fairly good sparks. Though, it was not enough to get an outdoor/dry timber campfire going while on a backpacking trip with my daughter in the Wind River range (Wyoming). After a fair amount of tries, and a good bit of flashes/sparks, even with dry paper thrown in, we reverted to a set of good old fashoned storm/water proof matches. A good value proposition as a general tool in the outdoors.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Fan

customer_reviews.title: I love this knife set
customer_reviews.text: Used it last weekend on a camping trip. The entire campfire came together with this one useful tool. From the small tender to sparking off the tender nest into a perfect fire using the attached ferro rod. It is also very easy to keep a razor sharp edge on. It didn't take long after I got home home to get it sharper than it came from the factory. Very pleased with this all in one type tool. Will buy my daughter one later
customer_reviews.author: Dale Frazier

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for the camper/survivalist
customer_reviews.text: If you are planning a camping trip or adventuring in the wilderness this is a handy little multifunctional tool sporting a strong blade which is part serrated and holds its edge. The fire lighter produces a very good spark every time making fire starting easy. The sheath is strong and robust and will last years. Has a tiny whistle on the rope on the handle which works fine. I like the knife and it does what it says in the description. If you are a serious survivalist looking for the utmost in a tool this may not be for you, but for the everyday camper this is money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: Blagger

customer_reviews.title: more than pleased
customer_reviews.text: what to say , well i plan on getting some more of bears signature series , especially after the pleasant surprise this knife is. Im not some crazy survivalist or hardcore camper, i just want a cool utility knife in case S*** jumps off , and i am more than pleased with this knife, it bigger than i expected very solid , the build in fire starter is nice , sharper would be good, and who doesnt need a good rape whistle ...lol, good stuff cant wait to get all the other bear grylls stuff
customer_reviews.author: david babbitt

customer_reviews.title: Flint is hard to pull
customer_reviews.text: Good knife, but the flint can be very difficult to pull out.
customer_reviews.author: Eli

customer_reviews.title: Dad loved it!
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a Christmas present for my father, and it was perfect! He loved it so much he actually tried out the firestarter in the house, much to my mother's dismay (haha). All around excellent quality as you'd expect from any Gerber product. Arrived on time in excellent packaging; would absolutely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Allen

customer_reviews.title: ... for my 20 year old nephew and he genuinely loved it. It looks and feels like a high ...
customer_reviews.text: This knife was purchased as a gift for my 20 year old nephew and he genuinely loved it. It looks and feels like a high quality knife and the case is durable, nice looking, and heavy duty. Gerber makes quality knives and this is no exception. I was really impressed and so was my brother, who knows a quality knife when he sees one. When my nephew opened the knife, my brother told him, wow, that's a really nice, expensive knife! The knife has a matte finish, and velcro was strong on the case. Perfect gift. I'm VERY happy I bought this one.

customer_reviews.title: and ergonomics of the knife are great. This knife has the most comfortable handle I ...
customer_reviews.text: The sheath, fire starter, and ergonomics of the knife are great. This knife has the most comfortable handle I have ever experienced on a knife. However, the steel on the knife is sub-par for the jobs that this knife should be able to handle. My knife chipped out a large piece of steel along the serrations while doing some light batoning. If you want a hard use knife, get a KABAR, this is alright for light use.
customer_reviews.author: zeiten

customer_reviews.title: Trust the name Gerber before Grylls
customer_reviews.text: Very nice, very sharp and all-around great knife, I've always trust the name Gerber before Grylls and that's the reason I bought this knife. I keep it in my camping gear bag and its come in handy several times the fire starter work well too, also fun to scare the kids with lol! I've wanted this knife since I've seen it for sale, everywhere else will charge you $10-$20 more, so buy on Amazon and save some money! Love this knife so much I'm giving it as a Christmas gift to my uncle and brother!
customer_reviews.author: DH

customer_reviews.title: Good beginner knife
customer_reviews.text: There are more professional knives out there. For the price, this one is great for a day trip to do field work or keep in the car for backup. Not my primary for long backpacking but its got some cool features that could be helpful in a pinch. Never could get the flint to work well, but that could be my own fault. Case is nice and rugged, blade stays sharp but it doesn't get much abuse. Recommended for a teen/young adult.
customer_reviews.author: mrk

customer_reviews.title: good knife for the price
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband and he likes it. Admittedly I wondered what he needed this for, but it has come in handy while hiking, camping, and general outdoors stuff. Blade construction seems solid. I try not to compare to older Gerber products - doesn't seem fair. Still a good knife for the price and it does what it states on the packaging. Seems to have stayed sharp and we've used it quite a bit.
customer_reviews.author: ALL83

customer_reviews.title: very pleased
customer_reviews.text: What to say , well, i definitely plan on getting some more of bears signature series , especially after the pleasant surprise this knife is. Im not some crazy survivalist or hardcore camper, i just want a cool utility knife in case you no what jumps off , and i am more than pleased with this knife, it bigger than i expected very solid , the build in fire starter is nice , sharper would be good, and who doesnt need a good sos whistle ...lol, good stuff!!! cant wait to get all the other bear grylls stuff
customer_reviews.author: david babbitt

customer_reviews.title: This knife is a great tool to have when camping
customer_reviews.text: This knife is a great tool to have when camping. It is incredible sharp and cuts through anything with ease thanks to its serrated edge. It has a good grip and has a good balance. On the bottom of the knife there is a pounder that you can use to pound in stakes or tenderize meats. It also has two holes at the bottom of the blade that you can feed string to tie it as a spear. The sheath is great as well. It fits onto a belt with ease and also includes a fire starter. I would highly recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: JVizcaya

customer_reviews.title: Awesome multifunction survival tool
customer_reviews.text: Gerber's BG line of blades and products are excellent. I bought this when my wife and I went hiking in Rocky Mountain National Park. I didn't expect to need it and thankfully we didn't need it, but it was nice to have along just in case. This has a nice size blade (with serrated section), firestarter and blade sharpener. Great piece of survival gear.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas J. Yunker

customer_reviews.title: Great Knife
customer_reviews.text: This is a great knife. It has a good weight and feels like quality which I always expect from Gerber. The fire steel works great. I have not used the sharpener but it looks like a good one. The whistle is useless unless you are actually lost in the mountains and want to be found, which I do not intend to ever be. Just in case though, I left it attached. My only complaint, like several other reviewers, is that the loops on the sheath are too small. I can barely squeeze my belt through them.
customer_reviews.author: Jam til Impact

customer_reviews.title: I love it, but granted, I've never used it
customer_reviews.text: I'm more of a cool-knife-collector. This one will get used once a year on my namsy-pamsy camping trips, which are glorified campfires on warm nights with a bathroom close by. Knife construction seems totally fine. I like the feel, the look, and the novelty. Does it start a fire? Heck if I know. Let's get real. If you want a real knife and kit for REAL survival, chances are you aren't buying a knife with Bear Grylls picture on it, anyway, that's sold at Target.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: sharp knife with a good grip
customer_reviews.text: Great knife overall. The rubber like grip is nice, allows for a secure grip on a very very sharp knife. The whistle isn't as loud as I thought it would be, but I guess it will have to work. The fire starter stick works great. Hopefully you can buy these individually from Gerber because I played with mine a little too much starting fires that were different degrees of dampness. Over all the knife is very good for the price, a nice little kit. Only giving it 4 stars because of the whistle.
customer_reviews.author: pchunterpa

customer_reviews.title: The knife feels great, full tang
customer_reviews.text: The knife feels great, full tang....BUT....they still haven't addressed the steel....its soft. Took it and tapped it to some metal. It dented the edge very easy. Overall, would keep it as a backup/truck knife. Camping it would be fine ....fighting Russian SF ninja trained zombies? Look elsewhere
customer_reviews.author: mward

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy knife. whistle works and the flint DOES NOT ...
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy knife. whistle works and the flint DOES NOT FALL OUT. its really in there good.. put a lanyard on it to ensure our fire making abilities.. but its really nice.. I sharpened it with an angle sharpener and its really nice now
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: If the metal was a bit more durable I would ...
customer_reviews.text: If the metal was a bit more durable I would give this knife 5 stars. That being said, this knife is quite appropriate for the majority of outdoor knife-needs. The fire-starter and whistle are both much more handy than I previously anticipated. I keep para chord attached and I've got combustion, cordage, cutting, chopping, and communication. If I get lost in the woods, this is why I will survive.
customer_reviews.author: Hunter Blakely

customer_reviews.title: Great knife, arrived quickly
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband for a birthday gift. He LOVES it!!!
customer_reviews.author: femimommyof3🤙🏽

customer_reviews.title: Star endorsement gimmick or not, this is a great knife.
customer_reviews.text: I'm usually against anything so commercial or gimmicky, but honestly this is a great knife for the price. I'm a knife geek and was happy to put this through a standard set of realistic abuse tests. Because of the quality, features and price, I think everyone should have this knife.
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product. High quality that does exactly what it is meant to do!
customer_reviews.text: This has handled everything I've thrown at it. Even caught my son prying and thought the tip was going to break, but it held strong. The handle works well.
customer_reviews.author: G2 Sugar Daddy

customer_reviews.title: Tough knife
customer_reviews.text: The actual is built sturdy, as a full tang should be. The sheath seems like it will hold up to whatever you might wanna throw at it. The only reason for 4 stars instead of 5 is because the fire started broke after the first use. The mechanism which is just a flimsy plastic piece and an o ring came off and it no longer stays put in the sheath. I considered returning the knife but its really too nice to give back because of a crummy fire starter, which actually works really well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One for Me, One for the "Boy"
customer_reviews.text: Just ordered one of these for my adult son for his birthday. He takes the grandsons out camping now and then and has a pretty low budget when it comes to camp tools. I can't wait to hear from him, once he's had a chance to look this knife over and try it out on a camping trip. I got mine about a year ago and have been generally well pleased with it. Someone gave me the fine-edged version for Christmas this past year, so now I am doubly pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Silver City Slim

customer_reviews.title: Sharp and dependable.
customer_reviews.text: This was the reduce to the first knife. No more breaking when you hit it again a branch. Cuts great, flint works great. I use this a lot for camping and around the yard. The sheath is great, no tips, cuts or tears yet.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Pretty much every feature broke after one use. Shows poor quality and zero durability.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty much every feature broke after one use. Shows poor quality and zero durability. Refund pending. Brought this along on a 3d backpacking trip and used it on the 2nd night to make a fire and generally test out this seemingly useful tool. 1. The retaining clip that holds the knife in the plastic sheath broke pretty much immediately from simple in and out use. 2. The serrated/saw teeth while effective showed heavy wear after simple sawing of soft woods. Looks as if I sawed concrete. 3. The knife rusted in a number of spots despite thorough cleaning and drying after use. 4. Tip of knife bent. 5. Fire starter works very well.
customer_reviews.author: Clark

customer_reviews.title: Great knife! Universal with many options.
customer_reviews.text: Very well built, quality is great. This knife has everything you need to be able to hunt or hike. We have used the flint many times to start a fire, sharpening stone works great and the sheath makes carrying the knife very safe.
customer_reviews.author: Marc Nipp

customer_reviews.title: I've had this blade for the better part of a week now
customer_reviews.text: I've had this blade for the better part of a week now, and I love everything about it. Sharp and very thick metal. Some of the reviewers stated that they had a problem with the pommel falling off after banging it around, but I have subjected it to some intense abuse and have had no such problem. Apparently this particular problem has been remedied. Love the diamond sharpener and fire starter. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Demon Desert

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value!
customer_reviews.text: I’m kinda embarrassed to love a cheeky knife like this but it is as good as it gets for the money. Had a sog camping knife that my wife got in the divorce and didn’t have the budget for another but honestly I’m as happy with this!
customer_reviews.author: Ben Hornung

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product. Well built
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. Well built, lots of features for the price, and good steel in the blade. I do a lot of fishing in the back country, and it is nice to have a light weight tool I can count on for multiple functions. The handle is narrow, so if you have big hands it might not be a good fit, though the grip is excellent. I have small hands, and it fits well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic knife. Fits well in the hand
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic knife. Fits well in the hand, the sheath is well made and all the extras fit great such as the fire starter and sharpener. By the way this knife on Amazon was over $10 less than Pro Bass Shops.
customer_reviews.author: IluvMovies

customer_reviews.title: Great little knife
customer_reviews.text: Great little knife, excellent grip. I keep it in my riding pack.
customer_reviews.author: AJV

customer_reviews.title: Great set up!
customer_reviews.text: This knife is a great set up. You have a strong knife that you can baton smaller logs into kindling, and then use it to start a fire. Very impressed with this knife! We took it to camp and went out on the beach and gathered up some drift wood and created a fire with it. It is comfortable in the hand and over all very well built. Love the fact that it has a fire starter and a sharpener with it. Great adventure knife!
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Love this knife.
customer_reviews.text: This knife is razor sharp out of box. Comes with a sharpener on the back. Works very well and like that its all one peice. You can beat this knife up and it lasts. Has a small area on the back to strike fire starter. Very smart idea and works super well. There isnt a feature on this knife that i dont like. Blade thinkness is thick and can withlast thousands of sharpenings as well as hitting it with hard objects to get through trees and large branches. Very very durable love this.
customer_reviews.author: Harrison B.

customer_reviews.title: For the Hunter or Survivalist in your life
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my husband and he loves it! The knife is a very sturdy metal and has a night slip cover. He has used this in many situations it is also a great to for survival just in case you become stranded. I would defiantly purchase this item or one from this company again hands down.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany Ratterree

customer_reviews.title: Excellent knife and survival kit
customer_reviews.text: I bought this knife as a good cheap leave it in my hunting pack and forget about item.This knife is well made(Gerber stands behind their knives) and all the extra's help with that "what if" scenario that no person wants to experience.The knife is very sharp out of the package and i will have to break it in to see how long it takes to put an edge back on it.Except for the orange handle i am very impressed with it.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Best knife ever owned... Yep.
customer_reviews.text: Saying this is the best knife I own hasn't come easy. Firstly, im a crkt fan; always have been, always will be. Secondly, I've never been a fan of Gerber; I don't know what it is, the name? The quality (lack there of)? Now that I own this knife I can truly say I have completely reconsidered the brand. The knife is exactly what it looks like, full tang, well made sheath and the fire starter is stellar. I won't bore you with the details, long story short is this: I loved the knife so much, I bought 5 of them for my groomsmen for our wedding... In over a year. Good Luck.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: not a bad knife, but will go with a straight blade ...
customer_reviews.text: New to bushcraft, not a bad knife, but will go with a straight blade next time. Versatile set up with fire starter, sharpener, hand signals, and whistle, but would look else where for a knife that would be my main carry/camping/life saving knife.
customer_reviews.author: NotHappy

customer_reviews.title: Bear Grylls Ultimate Knife
customer_reviews.text: As one who has owned knives all of his life and is a fan of Man Vs. Wild, I was quite intrigued by the Bear Grylls Ultimate Knife. I purchased and received the knife last week and honestly was very impressed. The orange accent color is a bit bright but the overall product, including the sheath and fero rod fire starter, is a steel for the price Amazon.com is offering it for. My advise if you are considering buying it, is to do it.
customer_reviews.author: JWagner

customer_reviews.title: Well-Made And Molded For Great Fit
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy and molded to fit your hand just perfectly, even when using to cut in multiple directions. The fire-starter, quick survival guide, whistle, and sharpener are all very useful and as advertised. Find myself using it often, even for everyday uses.
customer_reviews.author: richandsteph

customer_reviews.title: Quality. Durable. Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: For what I use this knife for its perfect. Keeps a good edge. Comfortable In your hand. Good all around utility knife.
customer_reviews.author: C. Keele

customer_reviews.title: Great field knife!
customer_reviews.text: All I can say is that this is well build and very comfortable for the price. This is not a combat knife, it's some to take with you when you go out for a hike or camping. I have seen reviews that complain about the color, but if you drop it then its easy to find! Flint works great and the balance of the knife is wonderful. Not one to go in for celebrity products but I have to say this is pretty darn great! For all it comes with, and the quality it's worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Radiocep

customer_reviews.title: Feel lower quality, but performs great
customer_reviews.text: This is a decent knife, not feeling like it will be any problems. but the quality doesn't feel on par with Gerber, and made me reconsider the Bear Grylls line. It works, and it doesn't feel too cheap, but it doesn't feel like high quality either. The fire starter though worked great, sparks fly and don't just sprinkle.
customer_reviews.author: L. McNerneyTop Contributor: Smart Home

customer_reviews.title: Good knife
customer_reviews.text: Received as Christmas gift. Very durable and versatile knife. Handy sharpening stone attached, good feel handle, and convenient flint. Whistle was kind of an after thought, but comes off easy enough. I'm happy with the gift. Good knife for camping and hiking.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher H

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the investment
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for just under 2 years now and have not had any issues with it at all. The edge holds very well and I have not had any troulbe with the pommel breaking or falling off. The sheath is well made, it's surived several camping trips and the fire starter has worked very well for me. I would definitely buy another one of these and am considering buying another to have around
customer_reviews.author: Eric F

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the money
customer_reviews.text: Good idea on paper. I used this knife for a bit and changed my mind. I dont like the plastic all over it, its not full-tang so the hammer end will most likely break off, the sharpner is not bad but the knife itself cant get that sharp and dulls easily. Also you cant even sharpen the serrations with out extra stuff. Good for its price range I guess... I upgraded to an Ontario Knives Blackbird SK-5, and I will never go back that thing is a work of art.
customer_reviews.author: V

customer_reviews.title: Makes a great gift.
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these knives and I love them. I bought this one for a friend of mine as a gift.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Bible

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Gifted this to my boyfriend for his birthday since we are big fans of Bear Grylls and other survival shows. It was a big hit! He loved it and the firestarter works great. (Of course we tried it right away haha) great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great knife!
customer_reviews.text: My wife loves it and it has a built in Ferro rod so starting fires!
customer_reviews.author: Ragnar

customer_reviews.title: Perfect knife
customer_reviews.text: Well built knife. Perfect knife to keep on hand. Great all around knife. I use mine for camping and it is always in my truck. I bought one for my daughter at college to keep in her room for protection. I could've bought a less expensive knife for her, but this is a life long knife that will be useful for any use.
customer_reviews.author: Barry Neptune

product_meta.title: Gerber Bear Grylls Ultimate Knife, Serrated Edge [31-000751]
product_meta.description:
AMAZON.COM


From Gerber, the 31-000751 Bear Grylls Survival Series Ultimate Knife is designed to help you endure in the toughest environments. It features an ergonomic grip for comfortable handling and a dependable stainless steel blade with a versatile serrated edge. Additionally, the knife and military-grade nylon sheath are packed with innovative survival tools, including a fire starter, a diamond blade sharpener, an emergency whistle, and a pommel.

This survival knife includes an emergency whistle, pommel, and sheath with fire starter and blade sharpener (view larger). SHARP, DURABLE BLADE HANDLES TOUGH SURVIVAL TASKS
Built to offer the versatility that adventurers, backpackers, and hunters need in the wilderness, the Ultimate Knife features a versatile 4.75-inch drop-point blade. This blade is half serrated to make quick work of cutting rope and other fibrous materials. It features full-tang construction for overall durability, and it is crafted from hard stainless steel, which allows for excellent edge retention.

INNOVATIVE, ERGONOMIC DESIGN DELIVERS VERSATILITY
Survival tools are only useful if they're easy to handle, so this knife features a comfortable, rubberized grip that's textured to prevent slippage. And because being a true survivor means making innovative use of your tools, the knife's handle features two holes for securely lashing it to a stick for use as a fishing spear--or whatever other bladed tool your situation calls for.

The included "Priority of Survival" pocket guide by Bear Grylls includes experience-based survival advice and instruction (view larger). In addition, the handle base features a stainless steel pommel that can be used for pounding or hammering. A lanyard cord helps you keep track of the knife, and the lanyard features an integrated emergency whistle that can be used to attract attention--so others can keep track of you.

Balanced for optimum handling, this Gerber Bear Grylls Survival Series Knife has an overall length of 10 inches and weighs just 11.2 ounces — 14.72 ounces with the included sheath.

MILITARY-GRADE NYLON SHEATH WITH SMART DETAILS
Just as versatile as the knife it protects, the included sheath folds open to reveal a diamond sharpener. The sheath also has a life-saving fire starter rod locked into a water-tight holder. This ferrocerium rod produces a shower of hot sparks when scraped against the rough surface of the striker notch that is incorporated into the back of the knife blade. For further versatility and functionality, the sheath includes a waterproof "Priority of Survival" guide tucked into a protective pocket on the back of the sheath.

The nylon sheath is crafted from lightweight, military-grade materials that are mildew resistant for long-term use in harsh climates. It includes a Velcro closure to keep your knife secure.

ABOUT THE GERBER BEAR GRYLLS SURVIVAL SERIES
Bringing together the 70 years of expertise behind all Gerber Legendary Blades and the survival and adventure experience of the renowned Bear Grylls, the Bear Grylls Survival Series is a one-of-a-kind line of knives, tools, and gear. A former member of the British SAS, a prolific adventurer, and the daring host of Discovery Channel's Man vs. Wild, Bear Grylls is no stranger to extreme situations. Each item in the Survival Series is thoughtfully designed by Bear and Gerber to offer features that can help keep a smart adventurer alive in the wild. These dependable tools come with Bear's "Priorities of Survival" pocket guide, so you can check your instincts against his experience-based advice.

WHAT'S IN THE BOX
Gerber 31-000751 Bear Grylls Survival Series Ultimate Knife, nylon sheath, and "Priorities of Survival" pocket guide.

31-000751 BEAR GRYLLS SURVIVAL SERIES ULTIMATE KNIFE, SERRATED EDGE
AT A GLANCE
 * 4.75-inch half-serrated drop-point blade for quick, versatile cuts
 * Full-tang, stainless steel construction for durability
 * Ergonomic, non-slip rubber grip for comfortable, accurate handling
 * Lanyard includes loud emergency whistle
 * Military-grade, mildew resistant nylon sheath
 * Sheath includes fire starter and diamond blade sharpener


From the highest peaks of the Himalayas, to the rainforests of South America, if world renowned outdoorsman Bear Grylls is on an adventure you can be sure he's equipped with the most durable outdoor gear Gerber has to offer (view larger). 

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Introducing the Gerber Bear Grylls Survival Series gear. This collaboration brings together Gerber’s over 70 years of knife and gear expertise with Bear Grylls’ extensive outdoor survival and adventure experience to create a one-of-a-kind line of knives, tools, and gear. From his time in the British SAS, to scaling Mount Everest, to hosting his survival television show all over the globe, Bear knows what it takes to be a survivor in extreme situations. Each item in the Survival Series is meticulous designed by Gerber and Bear to offer a multitude of uses in any environment.

The Ultimate Knife is the pinnacle of Gerber’s Bear Grylls Survival Series. Intricately designed by Gerber and Bear, it’s loaded with innovations that won’t be found in any other fixed blade knife. Like everything in the Survival Series, it also includes Bear’s Priorities of Survival pocket guide. Super useful in the wild, it offers a vital edge to any survivor.

Knife Features:

 * 1/2 Serrated high carbon stainless steel drop point blade--ideal for edge retention and cutting rope
 * Full tang blade construction for maximum durability
 * Ergonomic textured rubber grip maximizes comfort and reduces slippage
 * Stainless steel pommel at base of handle for hammering
 * Emergency whistle integrated into lanyard cord

Sheath Features: * Fire starter--Ferrocerium rod locks into sheath, striker notch incorporated into back of knife blade
 *  Lightweight, military-grade, mildew resistant nylon sheath
 * Land to air rescue instructions
 * Diamond sharpener integrated into sheath for on-the-go sharpening
 * Priorities of Survival pocket guide contains Bear’s survival essentials

Tech Specs: *  Length: 10 inches
 * Blade Length: 4.75 inches
 * Weight: 11.2 ounces alone, 14.72 ounces with sheath
feature_bullets: ½ Serrated High Carbon Stainless Steel Drop Point Blade - Ideal for edge retention and cutting rope
Ergonomic Textured Rubber Grip - Maximizes comfort and reduces slippage
Stainless Steel Pommel - At base of handle for hammering
Fire Starter - Ferrocerium rod locks into sheath, striker notch incorporated into back of knife blade
Nylon Sheath - Lightweight, military-grade, mildew resistant
